snippet.title: Building a Culture of Quality
snippet.description:
# Building a Culture of Quality and Engineering Excellence | Martin Hinshelwood  

ðŸ‘‹ Hi, Iâ€™m Martin Hinshelwood from [NKD Agility](https://www.nkdagility.com), and in this video, I explore how to build a **culture of quality** within your organization. Delivering great products isnâ€™t just about tools or processes, itâ€™s about fostering technical leadership, engineering excellence, and shared accountability across your teams. Using real-world examples, including lessons from Boeing and Volkswagen, Iâ€™ll show you why culture is the foundation of innovation and trust.

**ðŸ“Œ Chapters:**  
1. 00:00 â€“ Introduction: Why Culture is Critical to Quality  
2. 03:00 â€“ Engineering Excellence: Lessons from Boeingâ€™s Rise and Fall  
3. 07:15 â€“ The Risks of Prioritizing Revenue Over Quality  
4. 10:30 â€“ Agile Frameworks Are Tools, Not Solutions  
5. 13:45 â€“ What a Culture of Quality Looks Like in Practice  
6. 17:00 â€“ Empowering Teams with Knowledge and Leadership  
7. 20:30 â€“ How Naked Agility Can Support Your Journey  

**ðŸŽ¯ Who This Video is For:**  
- Engineering leaders aiming to build a culture of excellence within their teams  
- Product owners and business leaders focused on long-term product quality  
- Agile practitioners seeking to align tools and frameworks with organizational culture  
- Organizations looking to prevent failures caused by cultural and ethical missteps  

**ðŸ“– What Youâ€™ll Learn:**  
- Why a culture of quality requires collective responsibility and technical leadership  
- The dangers of prioritizing short-term revenue over long-term value  
- Real-world examples of cultural collapse from Boeing and Volkswagen  
- How Agile frameworks fit into a culture of quality and why theyâ€™re just tools  
- Strategies for empowering teams with knowledge, leadership, and engineering excellence  

**ðŸ’¡ Key Takeaways:**  
- Tools and frameworks are only as effective as the culture that uses them.  
- A culture of quality prevents ethical lapses and fosters innovation and trust.  
- Technical leadership and engineering excellence are contagious, when demonstrated, they inspire others.  
- Building a culture of quality takes time, effort, and a focus on shared values.  

At [NKD Agility](https://www.nkdagility.com), we partner with organizations to build a culture of quality, technical leadership, and engineering excellence. We canâ€™t do it for you, but weâ€™ll help you understand the theories, practices, and decisions that lead to great products. Ready to start? Visit us today and letâ€™s build the future together.
